intro: Cyrtandra tarsodes, commonly known as the Tarsodes heliconia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that are typically orange or red in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal forests and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
